meanings.definition: To attempt or make an effort
meanings.sent1: I will trye to finish my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always tries her best in school.
meanings.sent3: Let's trye to beat the rain and go for a walk.
meanings.sent4: He tried to reach the top of the mountain but couldn't make it.
meanings.sent5: The little bird tried to fly for the first time.

meanings.definition: To test or put to the test
meanings.sent1: The chef will trye the new recipe before adding it to the menu.
meanings.sent2: They trye the strength of the bridge by driving heavy trucks over it.
meanings.sent3: Let's trye this theory in the lab and see what happens.
meanings.sent4: Life often tries us with challenges to make us stronger.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will trye the students' knowledge with a surprise quiz.

meanings.sent1: She will trye to become a better swimmer by practicing every day.
meanings.sent2: They trye to save money by cutting unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The team will trye to win the championship this year.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, we must trye to overcome obstacles.
meanings.sent5: He tries to be kind to everyone he meets.

meanings.sent1: Please trye this soup and let me know if it needs more salt.
meanings.sent2: They trye the different flavors of ice cream before choosing their favorite.
meanings.sent3: I will trye a small piece of the cake to see if it's too sweet.
meanings.sent4: The chef will trye the sauce to make sure it's seasoned perfectly.
meanings.sent5: Let's trye the new dish on the menu tonight.

meanings.sent1: The detective will trye the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: Scientists trye the data to understand the patterns in nature.
meanings.sent3: Let's trye the document for any errors before submitting it.
meanings.sent4: The doctor will trye the patient's symptoms to make a diagnosis.
meanings.sent5: It's important to trye all possibilities before drawing a conclusion.
